SEARCH
Package GameEngine

Class GameEngine

java.lang.Object
GameEngine.GameEngine
All Implemented Interfaces:
IClockListener, IInputListener
public class GameEngine extends Object implements IInputListener, IClockListener
Responsible for taking a scene and running the game contained within it. Upon calling the start method, this class will make sure all the GameObjects contained within the scene fed into the class through the init method will be rendered (if so desired), updated, collisions will be checked, and input will be read. The configuration as to how the game engine will run is defined in the GameEngineFlags class. Before the first update, the start method is called for every game object. (only once) The order of operations upon each update are as follow: 0. input (if in stepped mode) 1. early update 2. update 3. collision checking 4. late update 5. rendering (if provided a camera) When the cycle stops, the stop method is called for every game object. (only once)
See Also:
  • Scene
  • GameObject
  • Renderer
  • CollisionManager

  • Method Details

    • getInstance

      public static GameEngine getInstance()
      Gets the game engine instance
      Returns:
      the game engine instance

    • init

      public void init(GameEngineFlags flags, Scene scene, Rectangle camera)
      Initializes the game engine. if the engine was still running prior to the calling of this method, it will be ungracefully stopped, overwritting everything. The stop method on the game objects of the scene being overwritten will NOT be called
      Parameters:
      flags - the flags defining the behaviour of the game engine
      scene - the scene to be ran by the game engine
      camera - the section of space to be rendered (can be null)

    • init

      public void init(GameEngineFlags flags, Scene scene)
      Initializes the game engine without renderization. same as init(GameEngineFlags,Scene,Rectangle)
      See Also:
      • init(GameEngineFlags,Scene,Rectangle)

    • start

      public void start()
      Starts the game engine, starting the game engine lifecycle. Calls the start method of all the game objects in the scene and sets the current scene as active.
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if the engine is already running or if the engine has not been initialized yet

    • stop

      public void stop()
      Stops the game engine, stopping the engine lifecycle and the core loop. the current scene is set to inactive and calls the stop method of all the game objects within the current scene Does not throw exception if the engine is not running.

    • onInputReceived

      public void onInputReceived(String input)
      Description copied from interface: IInputListener
      Event called when input is received from stdin. Should only be called by the GameEngine
      Specified by:
      onInputReceived in interface IInputListener
      Parameters:
      input - the input received

    • priorityInput

      public void priorityInput(String input)
      Called when received input. Runs before the other InputListeners.
      Parameters:
      input - the input received

    • step

      public void step(long deltaT)
      Runs a game engine cycle. Should only be used when the update method is through code.
      Parameters:
      deltaT - the delta time in ms since last update

    • step

      public void step()
      Runs a game engine cycle. same as step(long) but gets the time elapsed since last update
      See Also:
      • step(long)

    • setScene

      public void setScene(Scene newScene)
      Sets a new scene. can be used with engine still running, replacing the current scene. From the GameObject's perspective it's as if the game engine has just started.
      Parameters:
      newScene - the scene to be set in the game engine

    • tick

      Description copied from interface: IClockListener

      Specified by:
      tick in interface IClockListener
      Parameters:
      deltaTimeMs - the time elapsed since the alst tick in ms
